communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Grappler incident reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All incident reports and dash cam video since January 1, 2023 documenting department personnel using a Grappler Police Bumper system.

2) Department policies and instructions governing the use of the Grappler Police Bumper system.

If you have any questions about this request, please do not hesitate to ask. If you would like to set up a time to discuss this request over the phone, please email me at tips@toddfeathers.com.

I am requesting these records as a journalist in order to write articles in the public interest about the operations of a government agency and not for any commercial purpose.

In the event that you determine certain records or portions of records are exempt from disclosure, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation of the records or portions of records being withheld and the statutory exemptions under which they are being withheld.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

communications.subject: Your City of Albuquerque public records request #24-13306 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Albuquerque ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-13306 has been submitted successfully. Greetings: We have received your request for public records and will begin processing your request. This correspondence is intended to acknowledge your request and alert you that it may take up to fifteen days to process your request. NMSA 1978 14-2-8(D). We will be in contact with you as we process your request if we need additional information or if it appears that your request is excessively burdensome and broad. Additionally, please let us know if you have or later acquire documents relating to your request and upload the records into NextRequest. Such additional information has proven to be a useful resource in identifying, locating, and producing additional records. Please be advised, if you are requesting lapel and/or 911 audio from the Albuquerque Police Department (APD), your request may take a significant amount of time to review and provide the records. In lieu of the 911 audio, my office can provide the Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD). The CAD provides information of when the call was received, when and what officers were dispatched, and a description of what happens throughout the incident. In addition, please keep in mind a 5 minute lapel video can take up to 20 minutes to review depending on the type of redactions that are necessary to complete. We will be in contact to discuss ways to narrow your request but you are also welcome to contact us to discuss narrowing options. If you have or later acquire documents relating to your request, please let us know and upload the records into NextRequest. Such additional information has proven to be a useful resource in identifying, locating, and producing additional records. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you would like to know the status of your request, and please communicate all questions and status updates via NextRequest. The Office of the City Clerk reserves the right to charge an advance/deposit fee for materials related to records production and data extraction.  You may access your request by signing into your NextRequest profile at the following website:  https://nextrequest.cabq.gov/users/sign_in  Sincerely, Ethan Watson City Clerk ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Albuquerque.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: [Invoice Created] City of Albuquerque public records request #24-13306
communications.communication:
City of Albuquerque ************************************************************************ An invoice has been created for record request #24-13306. Hello,   This communication will acknowledge completion/or partial completion of your public records request dated November 12, 2024. Please be aware: protected personal identifier information contained in the requested records was redacted pursuant to NMSA 1978, § 14-2-1.1. I have redacted portion(s) of the records because they are exempt from disclosure under IPRA, NMSA 1978, Section 14-2-1(A) (medical records); Section 14-6-1(A) (medical records); Section 14-2-1(L) (as otherwise provided by law, including NMRA Rule 11-504 (physician-patient and psychotherapist-patient privilege)). See generally 45 C.F.R. §§ 160, 164 (HIPAA). I also redacted certain information which could reveal the identities of undercover police officers or informants. This information is exempt from the Inspection of Public Records Act. See NMSA 1978, § 14-2-1.2(A)(7) (confidential sources, methods or information). If made public, the redacted information would seriously interfere with the effectiveness of criminal investigations and prosecutions, and endanger undercover police officers or informants. Responsive Records: * Reports (Invoiced) The responsive records are available for purchase, please see the invoice that was released to you for the price and mailing address; once we receive payment, we will mail the records to you; you may also come into our office to pay for and pick up the records with exact cash or check/money order. If you are seeking to inspect the responsive records free of charge, the inspection will take place at the City Clerk's Office, located at 600 2nd Street NW, 7th Floor, Albuquerque, NM 87102, Monday- Friday from 8am- 4:30pm. Please call our front desk to schedule an inspection 924-3650. Thank you for your patience. Sincerely, Adrianna Eylicio IPRA Tech Office of the City Clerk ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Albuquerque.
Technical support: See our help page

title: Amtrak Board of Directors - Meeting Agendas and Minutes | Sept 2024 (2nd request)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Amtrak Board of Directors - Meeting Agendas and Minutes | Sept 2024 (2nd request)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The agenda and minutes for any meeting of the Amtrak Board of Directors that occurred in the month of September 2024, including the meetings that were scheduled to be held on September 25th and September 26th.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Heckscher

title: Frederick C. Leonard Sr. (National Archives and Records Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Frederick C. Leonard Sr. (National Archives and Records Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Frederick C. Leonard Sr. Born Feb. 9, 1892; died Nov. 21, 1959.

The late Mr. Leonard was a decorated veteran who attended former President Eisenhower's Inauguration Ball.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that NARA has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

communications.subject: Re: [25-38773] Freedom of Information Act Request - Alexa Gagosz
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Gagosz,

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Act request dated March
21, 2025 for records relating to Frederick C. Leonard, Sr. (1982-1959).
Your request was received in this office, Archives II Textual Reference, on
the date of March 24, 2025 and assigned FOIA case number 25-38773.

It is possible that the Dwight D. Eisenhower Presidential Library
<https://www.eisenhowerlibrary.gov/> may contain records relating to
President Eisenhower’s Inauguration Ball, so we have cc’d them above and
they will provide a separate response.

Please note that the National Archives is the repository for the
permanently valuable non-current records of the Federal Government.
Although only 1-3% of the records created by the Federal Government are
transferred to the National Archives, our holdings consist of hundreds of
millions of records, the vast majority of which are not name-searchable.
You will need to begin your research by determining the agency with which
your subject interacted and exactly what types of records you wish to see.

We also suggest that you request a copy of his Official Military Personnel
File (OMPF)
<https://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records/about-service-records-0>.
OMPFs and individual medical reports for individuals who served with the
U.S. Army who were separated from the service after October 1912 and before
1960 are in the custody of NARA's National Personnel Records Center (NPRC)
in St. Louis. In many cases where personnel records were destroyed in the 1973
fire <https://www.archives.gov/personnel-records-center/fire-1973>, proof
of service can be provided from other records such as morning reports,
payrolls, and military orders, and a certificate of military service will
be issued. Please complete a GSA Standard Form 180
<https://www.archives.gov/files/research/order/standard-form-180.pdf> and
mail it to NARA's National Personnel Records Center, (Military Personnel
Records), 1 Archives Drive, St. Louis, MO 63138-1002. Veterans and next of
kin of deceased veterans also may use eVetRecs to request records. See eVetRecs
Help
<https://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records/evetrecs-help.html>
for instructions. If there is any information requested by the form that
you do not know, you may omit it or provide estimates (such as for dates),
but the more information you provide, the easier it will be to locate the
correct file if it survived the fire. For more information see Official
Military Personnel Files (OMPF), Archival Records Requests
<https://www.archives.gov/personnel-records-center/military-personnel/ompf-archival-requests>
.

Archival OMPFs may also be requested by visiting the Archival Research Room
<https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/research-room> at the National Archives
at St. Louis <https://www.archives.gov/st-louis>. Please see the linked web
pages for more information.  Please email stlarr.archives@nara.gov for
further assistance prior to making an appointment.



This concludes the processing of your request. We do not consider this a
denial of your FOIA request. If you are not satisfied with our action on
this request, your options for appeal and dispute resolution are attached.

Sincerely,

MOLLY KAMPH

Archives II Reference, Research Rooms &

Augmented Processing Branch

National Archives at College Park (Archives II)

molly.kamph@nara.gov

www.archives.gov

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: 2011 Crime Incident Requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2011
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P001217-032525
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of March 25, 2025, Reference # P001217-032525. 
Dear Kristina Block, 
The City of Lubbock received a public information request from you on March 25, 2025. Your request mentioned: 
“To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents. 
• Year(s) Requested: 2011 
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction. 

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts. 

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Kristina Block

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: communications & agreements – Cybercheck
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All agreements (contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents) made since Dec. 1, 2024 between the Allegheny County District Attorney Office and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2) All email exchanges, including attachments, between the Allegheny County District Attorney Office's staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between July. 1, 2023 and the present.

3) All emails, including attachments, exchanged between staff at the Allegheny County District Attorney's Office, that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2023 and the present. 

I kindly request that you waive all fees as I am a journalist and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest.

If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request.

If you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Hatcher

Best wishes,

Jessica

title: Use and policies for controlled firearms acquired through 1033 program (Oxnard Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Use and policies for controlled firearms acquired through 1033 program (Oxnard Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of your agency related to the deployment and use of controlled equipment obtained through the 1033 Program of the Department of Defense, as set forth below.

According to records posted by the Defense Logistics Agency (https://www.dla.mil/DispositionServices/Offers/Reutilization/LawEnforcement/PublicInformation/), your agency acquired controlled equipment through the 1033 program, including firearms, as reflected in the attached spreadsheet.

I. Requests for Records
Records Request No. 1: All Documents constituting, reflecting, relating to or that contain current use policies if any for each type of 1033-program controlled equipment, including situations or circumstances in which use is authorized or prohibited.

Records Request No. 2: Records that list the dates, locations, suspected offense(s) or rationale for operation, controlled equipment deployed, arrests, and uses of force for each deployment of 1033-program controlled equipment since July 1st, 2019, specifically: firearms, armored vehicles, and night vision equipment.

Records Request No. 3: All records of complaints regarding the use and impact of 1033-program controlled equipment, including correspondence, visual or audio-visual materials, and responses to complaints.

Records Request No. 4: Documents that constitute, reflect, relate to or that contain rationales or criteria for acquisition of 1033-program controlled equipment, prior to its acquisition.

II. Response Time
Please provide requested documents as they become available.

Please respond to this request in ten (10) days, either by providing the requested information or providing a written response setting forth the specific legal authority on which you rely in failing to disclose each requested record, or by specifying a date in the near future to respond to the request. See Cal. Gov’t Code § 6255. Pursuant to section 6253, please disclose all reasonably segregable non-exempt information from any portions of records you claim are exempt from disclosure.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, we ask that you make records available to us as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.

The American Friends Service Committee seeks this information as the requestor to promote and provide public access to these documents and increase civic engagement. Because this request is made on behalf of a nonprofit public interest organization, with the intent to make this material easily accessible to the public, we request that you waive any fees. In responding to this request, please keep in mind that Article 1, § 3(b)(2) of the California Constitution expressly requires you to broadly construe all provisions that further the public’s right of access, and to apply any limitations on access as narrowly as possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the Healing Justice Program at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Use and policies for controlled firearms acquired through 1033 program (Oxnard Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Aug. 6, 2021. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response. This communication was originally to greg.hebert@oxnardpd.org. Please see the following request. 
---
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of your agency related to the deployment and use of controlled equipment obtained through the 1033 Program of the Department of Defense, as set forth below.

According to records posted by the Defense Logistics Agency (https://www.dla.mil/DispositionServices/Offers/Reutilization/LawEnforcement/PublicInformation/), your agency acquired controlled equipment through the 1033 program, including firearms, as reflected in the attached spreadsheet.

I. Requests for Records
Records Request No. 1: All Documents constituting, reflecting, relating to or that contain current use policies if any for each type of 1033-program controlled equipment, including situations or circumstances in which use is authorized or prohibited.

Records Request No. 2: Records that list the dates, locations, suspected offense(s) or rationale for operation, controlled equipment deployed, arrests, and uses of force for each deployment of 1033-program controlled equipment since July 1st, 2019, specifically: firearms, armored vehicles, and night vision equipment.

Records Request No. 3: All records of complaints regarding the use and impact of 1033-program controlled equipment, including correspondence, visual or audio-visual materials, and responses to complaints.

Records Request No. 4: Documents that constitute, reflect, relate to or that contain rationales or criteria for acquisition of 1033-program controlled equipment, prior to its acquisition.

II. Response Time
Please provide requested documents as they become available.

Please respond to this request in ten (10) days, either by providing the requested information or providing a written response setting forth the specific legal authority on which you rely in failing to disclose each requested record, or by specifying a date in the near future to respond to the request. See Cal. Gov’t Code § 6255. Pursuant to section 6253, please disclose all reasonably segregable non-exempt information from any portions of records you claim are exempt from disclosure.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, we ask that you make records available to us as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.

The American Friends Service Committee seeks this information as the requestor to promote and provide public access to these documents and increase civic engagement. Because this request is made on behalf of a nonprofit public interest organization, with the intent to make this material easily accessible to the public, we request that you waive any fees. In responding to this request, please keep in mind that Article 1, § 3(b)(2) of the California Constitution expressly requires you to broadly construe all provisions that further the public’s right of access, and to apply any limitations on access as narrowly as possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the Healing Justice Program at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear John Lindsay-Poland, 
 
Thank you for registering with Oxnard CA Public Records Center. 
 
Your Login ID is:  116902-72861976@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, we ask that you make records available to us as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.

The American Friends Service Committee seeks this information as the requestor to promote and provide public access to these documents and increase civic engagement. Because this request is made on behalf of a nonprofit public interest organization, with the intent to make this material easily accessible to the public, we request that you waive any fees. In responding to this request, please keep in mind that Article 1, § 3(b)(2) of the California Constitution expressly requires you to broadly construe all provisions that further the public’s right of access, and to apply any limitations on access as narrowly as possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the Healing Justice Program at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_request_attachments/Alpha/116902/California1033ControlledEquipent.xlsx
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Foxnard-police-department-347%252Fuse-and-policies-for-controlled-firearms-acquired-through-1033-program-oxnard-police-department-116902%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAcqyVPgf5zmxy4fjIgt1uZrBI%3A1trVjQ%3AHNCHPJ9SdtbFw9stwbUr0sIH1mOjOIWali8ozfThGW4" 
 
 You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the City of Oxnard's Public Records Center. communications.subject: Date Extension - Extension with need to allow consultation between departments P000276-030925
communications.communication:
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of March 09, 2025., Reference # P000276-030925. 
 
Dear John Lindsay-Poland: 
 
This email serves as a follow up to your recent Public Records Act Request received March 09, 2025. 
After reviewing the request and consulting with staff, we ascertained a proper search will necessitate an extension of time as described under Government Code Section 7922.535(c)(3); due to the need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another agency having substantial interest in the determination of the request or among two or more components of the agency having substantial subject matter interest therein. 
 
The additional research and time will add 14 days to the original 10. We look forward to sending you a response on or before 4/3/2025. 
 Sincerely, Melissa Garibay

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST Reference # P000276-030925. Dear John Lindsay-Poland, The City of Oxnard has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Apologies for this not going out on April 11, 2025 I am not sure if there was a glitch in the system or I forgot to hit send. Please see response below, as well as attachments. Records Request No. 1: All Documents constituting, reflecting, relating to or that contain current use policies if any for each type of 1033-program controlled equipment, including situations or circumstances in which use is authorized or prohibited. I have attached our Military Equipment Policy 708. 
Records Request No. 2: Records that list the dates, locations, suspected offense(s) or rationale for operation, controlled equipment deployed, arrests, and uses of force for each deployment of 1033-program controlled equipment since July 1st, 2019, specifically: firearms, armored vehicles, and night vision equipment. We only have seven (7) M-1 Grand Rifles, used for ceremonial purposes only, never deployed in the field with live ammunition. We do not have a record of each use. 
Records Request No. 3: All records of complaints regarding the use and impact of 1033-program controlled equipment, including correspondence, visual or audio-visual materials, and responses to complaints. None 
Records Request No. 4: Documents that constitute, reflect, relate to or that contain rationales or criteria for acquisition of 1033-program controlled equipment, prior to its acquisition. Attached. The records are attached to this message.  You may also access and retrieve these documents at by downloading them from the Public Records Center. title: GA CVR Data Request (2020, 2022, 2024) (Wayne County Board of Elections & Registrars)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GA CVR Data Request (2020, 2022, 2024) (Wayne County Board of Elections & Registrars)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2020 Nov General Elections
2. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
3. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the Dominion voting system. Forsyth County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report” at this link: https://www.forsythco.com/Departments-Offices/Voter-Registrations-Elections/Election-Results. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sergio Nino

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sergio Nino
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: January 23, 2024
Suspect: Sergio Nino, 16 (at the time of the incident)
Incident Summary:
Officers Kristofer Gries, Blake Willer, and Matthew Smith responded to a call from Nino’s father regarding a family dispute. Bodycam footage reportedly captures officers encouraging Nino’s father to physically discipline him, dismissing allegations of abuse, and making statements such as "Your dad should beat you" and "You have no rights." A confrontation ensued when Officer Willer attempted to take Nino’s phone, resulting in officers using force against him. Nino suffered a broken wrist, facial lacerations requiring stitches, and was subsequently hospitalized. He was charged with aggravated assault, though charges were later dropped.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Spoke with Sergio Nino’s father before engaging with the teenager.
Interacted with Sergio Nino, including advising his father on discipline.
Used force on Nino, leading to his injuries and subsequent arrest.
Transported Nino from the scene to medical facilities or booking.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SWAT Call Outs (Glendale Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to SWAT call-outs:
SWAT includes SEB or any similar division at your agency
Data recorded by the department into a database or in reports that have:
- the deployment reasons/nature of each SWAT call-out (mental health, barricaded suspect, assist with federal or local partners, etc)
- any use of force, including the use of tear-gas and explosive breaching rounds
- deployment of any specialized equipment (drones, MRAPs)
- conclusion of call 
- dates
I don't need information on the who of the investigations; I need the what (use of force, specialized equipment) and why (deployment reason, conclusion of call) of each deployment. 

Please keep in native .csv if it's from a database.

Search 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Esther Medina Arrest – February 19, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Esther Medina on February 19, 2025, at approximately 11:19 PM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD) in Dona Ana County, New Mexico. The arrest took place at or near 2341 Entrada Del Sol, Dona Ana, NM.

According to public records, Medina was arrested and charged with:

Three counts of Abuse of a Child – Statute: 20AB (Felony)

Aggravated DWI – Statute: 21B (Misdemeanor)

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including probable cause affidavits, officer narratives, and any supplemental documentation

Any available body-worn camera (BWC) footage from responding officers

911 call audio and transcripts related to this incident

CAD logs, dispatch notes, or internal communications

Any photographs, scene documentation, and forensic or toxicology reports

Documentation provided to or received from Child Protective Services or related agencies

This request is submitted in the public interest due to the serious charges involving child endangerment and aggravated driving while intoxicated.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Esther Medina on February 19, 2025, at approximately 11:19 PM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD) in Dona Ana County, New Mexico. The arrest took place at or near 2341 Entrada Del Sol, Dona Ana, NM. 

According to public records, Medina was arrested and charged with: 

Three counts of Abuse of a Child – Statute: 20AB (Felony) 

Aggravated DWI – Statute: 21B (Misdemeanor) 

I am specifically requesting: 

The full incident and arrest reports, including probable cause affidavits, officer narratives, and any supplemental documentation 

Any available body-worn camera (BWC) footage from responding officers 

911 call audio and transcripts related to this incident 

CAD logs, dispatch notes, or internal communications 

Any photographs, scene documentation, and forensic or toxicology reports 

Documentation provided to or received from Child Protective Services or related agencies 

This request is submitted in the public interest due to the serious charges involving child endangerment and aggravated driving while intoxicated. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Thomas Jackson 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flas-cruces-new-mexico-police-department-4431%252Festher-medina-arrest-february-19-2025-184512%252F%253Femail%253Dkperalta%252540las-cruces.org&url_auth_token=AAAWk2FNE129jWDSFr7SU9dcyI4%3A1u1cPE%3A2erKqBR2E6Augoz4wcOO2TRwDAfwVbA8hTkTZ558Sg4 
The purpose of this message is to provide you with a partial response to the Inspection of Public Records Act (hereinafter “IPRA”) request you provided the City of Las Cruces (hereinafter “City” or “Las Cruces”). The City has gathered, reviewed, and appropriately redacted the following public records associated with your request: 
Thirteen (13) videos 
 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) Section 14-2-1.1 states “Protected personal identifier information contained in public records may be redacted by a public body before inspection or copying of a record.” The term “protected personal identifier information” is defined within NMSA Section 14-2-6(F) to include:  (1) all but the last four digits of a: (a) taxpayer identification number;  (b) financial account number; (c) credit or debit card number; or (d) driver’s license number;  (2) all but the year of a person’s date of birth; (3) a social security number; and (4) with regard to a nonelected employee of a public body in the context of the person’s employment, the employee’s nonbusiness home street address, but not the city, state or zip code;  therefore, any of the above-described “protected personal identifier information” found within the responsive records have been redacted. 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1.2(A)(8) states, in pertinent part, that “Law enforcement records are public records, except “records pertaining to physical or mental examination and medical treatment of persons unless the information could be relevant to a criminal investigation or an investigation of misfeasance, malfeasance or other suspected violation of law conducted by a person elected to or employed by a public body,” and therefore, such records “may be redacted from a written record or digitally obscured in a visual or audio record.” Therefore, any medical records and/or the discussion of medical diagnosis found within the responsive records have been redacted. New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) Section 14-2-1(L) states “[e]very person has a right to inspect public records except as otherwise provided by law.”.  The Children's Code § 32A-4-33(A) states "All records or information concerning a party to a neglect or abuse proceeding, including social records, diagnostic evaluations, psychiatric or psychological reports, videotapes, transcripts and audio recordings of a child's statement of abuse or medical reports incident to or obtained as a result of a neglect or abuse proceeding or that were produced or obtained during an investigation in anticipation of or incident to a neglect or abuse proceeding shall be confidential and closed to the public."  Therefore, any records protected by the Children's Code contained within the responsive records have been redacted. A download link with the contents of this request has been e-mailed to you from AXON.  This download link expires in three (3) days. Please contact our office by replying to this email or via telephone if you have any issues accessing the documents or if you wish to receive the documents in another format. Pursuant to NMSA 1978, § 14-2-10, the City has determined that your written request is excessively burdensome and/or broad. More specifically, the City has determined that it requires an additional reasonable period of time to gather, review, and appropriately redact any and all public records associated with your request.  Although the City cannot anticipate when the remainder of the responsive records associated with your request will become available, the City will produce them within a reasonable period of time. Further, the City will provide a written status update regarding your request within fifteen (15) days. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Should you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact my office. Sincerely, 
Christine Rivera 
Records Custodian 
(575) 541-2112

RE: Police Records Request, Reference # P000734-040625 Dear Thomas Jackson, The City of Las Cruces received the following public records request from you on April 07, 2025: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Esther Medina on February 19, 2025, at approximately 11:19 PM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD) in Dona Ana County, New Mexico. The arrest took place at or near 2341 Entrada Del Sol, Dona Ana, NM. 

According to public records, Medina was arrested and charged with: 

Three counts of Abuse of a Child – Statute: 20AB (Felony) 

Aggravated DWI – Statute: 21B (Misdemeanor) 

I am specifically requesting: 

The full incident and arrest reports, including probable cause affidavits, officer narratives, and any supplemental documentation 

Any available body-worn camera (BWC) footage from responding officers 

911 call audio and transcripts related to this incident 

CAD logs, dispatch notes, or internal communications 

Any photographs, scene documentation, and forensic or toxicology reports 

Documentation provided to or received from Child Protective Services or related agencies 

This request is submitted in the public interest due to the serious charges involving child endangerment and aggravated driving while intoxicated. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Thomas Jackson 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flas-cruces-new-mexico-police-department-4431%252Festher-medina-arrest-february-19-2025-184512%252F%253Femail%253Dkperalta%252540las-cruces.org&url_auth_token=AAAWk2FNE129jWDSFr7SU9dcyI4%3A1u1cPE%3A2erKqBR2E6Augoz4wcOO2TRwDAfwVbA8hTkTZ558Sg4 
The purpose of this message is to provide you with a response to the Inspection of Public Records Act (hereinafter “IPRA”) request you provided the City of Las Cruces (hereinafter “City” or “Las Cruces”).  T he City has gathered, reviewed, and appropriately redacted the following public records associated with your request: 
Six (6) videos, two (2) documents, and fourty-seven (47) photos 
 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) Section 14-2-1.1 states “Protected personal identifier information contained in public records may be redacted by a public body before inspection or copying of a record.” The term “protected personal identifier information” is defined within NMSA Section 14-2-6(F) to include:  (1) all but the last four digits of a: (a) taxpayer identification number;  (b) financial account number; (c) credit or debit card number; or (d) driver’s license number;  (2) all but the year of a person’s date of birth; (3) a social security number; and (4) with regard to a nonelected employee of a public body in the context of the person’s employment, the employee’s nonbusiness home street address, but not the city, state or zip code;  therefore, any of the above-described “protected personal identifier information” found within the responsive records have been redacted. 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1.2(A)(8) states, in pertinent part, that “Law enforcement records are public records, except “records pertaining to physical or mental examination and medical treatment of persons unless the information could be relevant to a criminal investigation or an investigation of misfeasance, malfeasance or other suspected violation of law conducted by a person elected to or employed by a public body,” and therefore, such records “may be redacted from a written record or digitally obscured in a visual or audio record.” Therefore, any medical records and/or the discussion of medical diagnosis found within the responsive records have been redacted. 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1(J) states that every person has a right to inspect public records of this state except “information concerning information technology systems, the publication of which would reveal specific vulnerabilities that compromise or allow unlawful access to such systems; provided that this subsection shall not be used to restrict requests for (1) records stored or transmitted using information technology systems and (2) internal and external audits of information technology systems, except for those portions that would reveal ongoing vulnerabilities that compromise or allow unlawful access to such systems.” Therefore, any records that would disclose methods for unlawfully accessing technology systems contained within the responsive records have been redacted. New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) Section 14-2-1(L) states “[e]very person has a right to inspect public records except as otherwise provided by law.”.  The Children's Code § 32A-4-33(A) states "All records or information concerning a party to a neglect or abuse proceeding, including social records, diagnostic evaluations, psychiatric or psychological reports, videotapes, transcripts and audio recordings of a child's statement of abuse or medical reports incident to or obtained as a result of a neglect or abuse proceeding or that were produced or obtained during an investigation in anticipation of or incident to a neglect or abuse proceeding shall be confidential and closed to the public."  Therefore, any records protected by the Children's Code contained within the responsive records have been redacted. A download link with the contents of this request has been e-mailed to you from AXON.  This download link expires in three (3) days. Please contact our office by replying to this email or via telephone if you have any issues accessing the documents or if you wish to receive the documents in another format. The City considers its response to your request complete. 

Sincerely, 
Christine Rivera 
Records Custodian 
(575) 541-2112

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Business Insider record request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-- Copies of the “stop-work orders” related to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) activities connected to sponsored projects issued by a federal agency
-- Copies of the correspondence, including but not limited to emails messages, email attachments, text messages, video chat messages, and voicemails, between the Office of the Vice President for Research and project leads and principal investigators affected by these “stop-work orders”
-- Copies of any and all correspondence, including but not limited to emails messages, email attachments, text messages, video chat messages, and voicemails, between the federal agency and the university regarding these “stop-work orders”
-- Descriptions of the specific projects and/ or programs impacted by the “stop-work orders”
-- A list of the project leads and principal investigators affected by these “stop-work” orders

For reference, university president Amy Parsons sent a memo to the university on Jan. 28 that describes these stop-work orders. The memo specifically states "Some CSU researchers have received stop-work orders related to diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) activities connected to sponsored projects. All impacted project leads and principal investigators have been contacted by the Office of the Vice President for Research."

Please waive applicable fees; this information is being sought for newsgathering purposes in the public interest. As we are making this request as journalists and the information is timely, we also ask that you expedite processing for this request. If I can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of this request, please contact me directly.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicole Einbinder

communications.communication:
Please find our response attached.



Linda Schutjer

Colorado State University

Cell: 970-988-1270

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OPM FOIA Org Chart
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The current org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office, reflecting vacancies as of February 18, 2025.

2. The org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office on January 18, 2025, reflecting any vacancies on that date. 

Request for Expedited Processing

I hereby request expedited processing of this request. CNN reported all employees of OPM FOIA were terminated on or around February 17, 2025. If true, this would render the office unable to meet its statutory obligations, potentially violating the Anti-Deficiency Act, and thus, raising issues as to whether the President’s team is in violation of the Constitution’s Take Care clause.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Acknowledgment of FOIA Request No. 25-OESPIM-1282-F
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew Free: 
This email acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the U.S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) . Your request was received by this office on February 19, 2025, and was assigned tracking number 25-OESPIM-1282-F. You requested the following: 
1. The current org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office, reflecting vacancies as of February 18, 2025.2. The org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office on January 18, 2025, reflecting any vacancies on that date. 
Your request for expedited processing has been denied because you have not demonstrated that you meet the threshold requirement of being a person primarily engaged in disseminating information. Please note that due to current resource limitations we are experiencing prolonged delays in the processing of requests as we are working through a backlog. 
If you are not satisfied with OPM’s determination, you may administratively appeal in writing by email to OGCAtty@opm.gov. An appeal should include a copy of the initial request, a copy of this email denying your request for expedited processing, and a statement explaining why you believe the decision is wrong. Appeals must be electronically transmitted within 90 calendar days of the date of this email. 
Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS by e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or by mail at: 
Office of Government Information Services 
National Archives and Records Administration 
8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS 
College Park, Maryland 20740-6001 
We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. Sincerely, 
FOIA Requester Service Center 
Office of Personnel Management

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #25-OESPIM-1282-F
communications.communication:
I appeal.  

https://theappeal.org/authors/andrew-free/

https://www.aclu.org/publications/deadly-failures-preventable-deaths-in-us-immigrant-detention (Contributing Authors)

Please reverse the denial of Expedited Processing.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Amazon inland empire (San Bernardino City Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that Amazon has been active in the Inland Empire and among Inland Empire public agencies: https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2023-12-05/leaked-document-offers-glimpse-into-how-amazon-amasses-influence-in-the-inland-empire

https://twitter.com/LorenaSGonzalez/status/1732047860701782381/photo/4

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other information presented to the city/agency by Amazon 

2) A copy of any incident reports relating to Amazon, including attachments and media.

3) Any emails between the city/district and Amazon employees, including attachments and media. Please limit search to between Jan 1, 2023 and the time this request is processed

4) Any grants, gifts, contracts, between this agency and Amazon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

title: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Related Records – Jan. 15, 2025 Arrest of David Allsop (Flight 3772, DUI)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Related Records – Jan. 15, 2025 Arrest of David Allsop (Flight 3772, DUI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to public records related to the January 15, 2025 arrest of Southwest Airlines pilot David Allsop, age 52, at Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport, including:

All body-worn camera footage from officers involved in the investigation, detainment, and arrest of Mr. Allsop on DUI charges at the airport, beginning from initial contact near or before 7:00 a.m.

Surveillance or security footage from the airport (if available and not exempt), particularly any camera angles showing the pilot’s interaction with security, gate agents, or passengers.

Mr. Allsop was reportedly preparing to operate Southwest Flight 3772 to Chicago and was arrested before takeoff for allegedly showing visible signs of intoxication. The incident resulted in significant flight delays and raised public interest about aviation safety and pilot screening.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: RE: Open Records Request
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for your request for records under the Georgia Open Records Act.  However, we regret to inform you that we are unable to fulfill your request for information at this time. The records you have requested are exempt from public disclosure under Georgia Code § 50-18-72(a)(4). According to this provision, public disclosure is not required for:

"Records of law enforcement, prosecution, or regulatory agencies in any pending investigation or prosecution of criminal or unlawful activity, other than initial police arrest reports and initial incident reports; provided, however, that an investigation or prosecution shall no longer be deemed to be pending when all direct litigation involving such investigation and prosecution has become final or otherwise terminated; and provided, further, that this paragraph shall not apply to records in the possession of an agency that is the subject of the pending investigation or prosecution."

As the records you requested pertain to an ongoing investigation, they fall under this exemption and are unavailable until the case is officially closed.

Please note that this information has been provided in good faith as required under the Georgia Open Records Act, O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70, and should be used in accordance with Georgia law.  Any use of this information in violation of Georgia law or applicable state statutes is strictly prohibited.

Thank you,


Dawoud Stevenson
Senior Director of Program Management
Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport
400 Airways Avenue, Savannah, GA  31408
Phone:  912-964-0514
www.flySAV.com<http://www.flysav.com/>

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Related Records – Jan. 15, 2025 Arrest of David Allsop (Flight 3772, DUI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

This is a follow-up to my January 2025 request regarding the January 15, 2025 arrest of Southwest Airlines pilot David Allsop at Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport on DUI charges.

I understand the requested body-worn camera footage and surveillance video are currently exempt under O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72(a)(4), due to a pending investigation or prosecution.

Accordingly, I respectfully request the following:

1. Once the investigation and/or prosecution concludes, and the exemption no longer applies, please release the requested footage directly to me.
2. If release is not automatic, I ask that your office notify me when the case is closed and the records become subject to disclosure.
3. If any portion of the requested records can be released now—such as a redacted incident report, officer roster, or chain of custody log—I respectfully request those materials as well.

This request is made in the public interest and is not for commercial use. The footage pertains to a serious aviation safety matter involving the arrest of a pilot scheduled to operate Flight 3772, which generated significant public concern.

Thank you for your continued cooperation.

Sincerely,  
Police Cam News  
requests@muckrock.com

title: Notes from ERO Presentation on Fingerprints June 13, 2018

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Notes from ERO Presentation on Fingerprints June 13, 2018
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding a presentation by Janette M. Martinez called "ERO presentation on fingerprints" I am requesting the overview, notes, outline, materials, powerpoint presentation, and any other documents generated by Ms. Martinez for this presentation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Hoppock

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (March 2025) (Pacific County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: June 12, 2018 Media Response to Query
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A memo called "Media Response to Query" with the issue stated as "Opening of the HFE Office" and dated June 12, 2018. This was emailed by Donna Campagnolo on June 12, 2018 to Daniel Renaud as an attachment called "HFE - RTQ.docx"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Hoppock

communications.communication:
Thank you for your email. Here is a link to check your status online. You may check the status of your FOIA request at: https://first.uscis.gov/#/check-status<https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffirst.uscis.gov%2F%23%2Fcheck-status&data=04%7C01%7CGeorgette.L.Shirk%40uscis.dhs.gov%7Ca00b973f70bb44e81a1708d937348115%7C5e41ee740d2d4a728975998ce83205eb%7C0%7C0%7C637601520900411926%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=VwLBIStvX51HnuI0trGESav5VWQ3Q3dsMtHIfxei2hI%3D&reserved=0>

By checking your status online, this frees up our staff to process pending requests. We are currently experiencing a high volume of incoming requests. To ensure fairness for all FOIA requesters, FOIA operates on a first in, first out basis.

Your request is currently number 836 of 1343 pending requests. The estimated completion date is only an estimate. It depends on the complexity of the case and the complexity of the cases in line. The number in line is the best estimate of when your case will be completed.

Samantha

title: Inspector General closed cases 2016 (Defense Intelligence Agency, Office of the Inspector General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Inspector General closed cases 2016 (Defense Intelligence Agency, Office of the Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

a copy of the list or printout or database listing of Inspector General investigations closed/reports completed during calendar year 2016. If the list is organized by FY rather than calendar year, the FY 2016 list is sufficient for this request. If no central list or database exists, then I request that the equivalent information be provided in the form of copies of the cover sheet or first page of each IG report completed during calendar year 2016.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: SWAT Call Outs (Santa Ana Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SWAT Call Outs (Santa Ana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to SWAT call-outs:
SWAT includes SEB or any similar division at your agency
Data recorded by the department into a database or in reports that have:
- the deployment reasons/nature of each SWAT call-out (mental health, barricaded suspect, assist with federal or local partners, etc)
- any use of force, including the use of tear-gas and explosive breaching rounds
- deployment of any specialized equipment (drones, MRAPs)
- conclusion of call 
- dates
I don't need information on the who of the investigations; I need the what (use of force, specialized equipment) and why (deployment reason, conclusion of call) of each deployment. 

Please keep in native .csv if it's from a database.

Search 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Your City of Santa Ana public records request #25-799 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Santa Ana ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-799 has been submitted successfully. This will acknowledge that the City of Santa Ana received your Public Records Act request. The City will respond to your request within ten (10) days of receipt of this request in accordance with the California Public Records Act. Pursuant to the Email and Text Message Retention Policy of the City, all emails and text messages are retained for two (2) years and deleted on a rolling basis thereafter. Please be advised, Public Records Requests are only reviewed during regular business hours, from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Thursday and alternating Fridays.  Visit the online Holiday and Closed Friday Schedule at https://www.santa-ana.org/holiday-and-closed-friday-schedule ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Santa Ana.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Expedited FOIA requests (Department of Labor)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any FOIA request (including any request to expedite the request) in which a request to expedite production (on the basis of newsworthiness or an urgency to inform the public) was granted. This request is limited to requests received on or after January 1, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: DOL Grant of Fee Waiver
communications.communication:
March 19, 2025 Mr. Adam  Steinbaugh 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR182855 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA  02115 Re: Freedom of Information Act Request No. # 2025-F-08970 DearAdam  Steinbaugh: Thisletter responds to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of March 11, 2025 in which you requested To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:A copy of any FOIA request (including any request to expedite the request) in which a request to expedite production (on the basis of newsworthiness or an urgency to inform the public) was granted. This request is limited to requests received on or after January 1, 2024.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Adam Steinbaugh. Your request was received in our office on March 13, 2025,and assigned FOIA tracking number 2025-F-08970. Youhave requested a waiver of fees. In order to determine whetheryour request qualifies for a waiver of fees, pursuant to 29 CFR § 70.41, we must evaluate whetherdisclosure of the requested information is: not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. 
Basedon the above criteria, we have determined that you adequately addressed thestatutory requirements for a waiver of fees in your March 11, 2025, request. You have been granted a waiver of all fees associated with producing therecords requested. Please be advised, however, granting this waiver of fees does notautomatically apply to future requests. Requests for waivers of fees are determined on a case-by-case basis. Ifyou have any questions concerning my response to your request pleasecontact Viola Gonzales, Government Information Specialist at 936-270-1330. In addition, itwould be helpful to include the tracking number in any submission or to have itavailable at the time of a call. Sincerely, AgencyDisclosure Officer
