communications.subject: FOIA 2025-F-08977/Expedited Processing FOIA
communications.communication:
This is in response to your Freedomof Information request received in our office on 13/13/25 requesting the abovementioned records.  These records are nowavailable and have been enclosed for your information. You will note some informationhas been removed from the documents. This is authorized under the rules and regulations, includingexemptions, contained in the Freedom of Information Act and 29 CFR Part 70.  For specific numbers and wording ofexemptions, please refer to Attachment #1. You have the right to appeal this decision with theSolicitor of Labor within 90 days from the date of this letter.  Theappeal must state, in writing, the grounds for the appeal, including anysupporting statements or arguments.  The appeal should also include a copyof your initial request and a copy of this letter. If you appeal, you may mail your appeal to: Solicitor ofLabor, U.S. Department of Labor, Room N-2420, 200 Constitution Avenue, N.W.,Washington, D.C. 20210 or fax your appeal to (202) 693-5538. Alternatively, you may email your appeal to foiaappeal@dol.gov;appeals submitted to any other email address will not be accepted.  Theenvelope (if mailed), subject line (if emailed), or fax cover sheet (if faxed),and the letter indicating the grounds for appeal, should be clearly marked:“Freedom of Information Act Appeal.” (mailto:foiaappeal@dol.gov) Inaddition to filing an appeal, you may contact the Department’s FOIA PublicLiaison, Ramona Oliver at (202) 731-5491or oliver.ramona@dol.gov (mailto:oliver.ramona@dol.gov) for assistance inresolving disputes You also may contact the Office of Government InformationServices (OGIS) for assistance.  OGIS offers mediation services to resolvedisputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusivealternative to litigation.  Using OGIS services does not affect your rightto pursue litigation.  You may mail OGIS at the Office of GovernmentInformation Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601Adelphi Road – OGIS, College Park, MD 20740-6001. Alternatively, you may email or contact OGIS through itswebsite at: ogis@nara.gov (mailto:ogis@nara.gov) ; Web: https://ogis.archives.gov (https://ogis.archives.gov/) .  Finally,you can call or fax OGIS at: telephone: (202) 741-5770; toll-free:1-877-684-6448. It is also important to note that the services offered byOGIS, is not an alternative to filing an administrative FOIA appeal. If we can be of further assistance to you, please feel freeto contact this office at 516-334-3344 or email skoch.joanna@dol.gov (mailto:skoch.joanna@dol.gov) 
Enclosure ATTACHMENT #1 Most used exemptions paragraphs from 5 U.S.C. Section 552(b): #4                  Information that is classifiedas trade secrets and/or of commercial or financial value obtained from a personand is privileged or a confidential source of information. #5                  Inter-agency or intra-agencymemorandums or letters which would not be available by law to a party otherthan an agency in litigation with the Agency. #6                  This exclusion is intended toexclude from disclosure all personal and medical files, and all private orpersonal information contained in other files which, if disclosed to thepublic, would amount to a clearly unwarranted invasion of the privacy of anyperson, including members of the family of the person to whom the informationpertains. #7                  Information contained ininvestigatory files complied for law enforcement purposes except to the extentavailable by law to a party other than an agency. #7(C)            Information pertaining to theprivacy interests of individuals, including                        information about anindividual which he could reasonably assert an option to withhold from thepublic at large because of its intimacy or its possible adverse effect uponhimself or his family. #7(D)            The identification of a confidentialsource or confidential information furnished by a confidential source.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SWAT Call Outs (Irvine Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to SWAT call-outs:
SWAT includes SEB or any similar division at your agency
Data recorded by the department into a database or in reports that have:
- the deployment reasons/nature of each SWAT call-out (mental health, barricaded suspect, assist with federal or local partners, etc)
- any use of force, including the use of tear-gas and explosive breaching rounds
- deployment of any specialized equipment (drones, MRAPs)
- conclusion of call 
- dates
I don't need information on the who of the investigations; I need the what (use of force, specialized equipment) and why (deployment reason, conclusion of call) of each deployment. 

Please keep in native .csv if it's from a database.

Search 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Standardized Care Unit Financial Information (Office Of The City Manager)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Standardized Care Unit Financial Information (Office Of The City Manager)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- the budget and breakdowns of finances allocated to the Specialized Care Unit from August of 2023 to January of 2025
- the balance sheet and statement of cash flows generated by the Specialized Care Unit or whomever was responsible for the SCU in the Department of Behavioral Health, from the fiscal years of 2023 and 2024
- records of staffing within the Specialized Care Unit and the Bonita House Program (after the start of its partnership with the SCU in the 3rd quarter of 2023), including information regarding positions filled, salaries, benefits, and turnover rates

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

qq221

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California DOE letters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The March 27, 2025, letter received by the California Department of Education from the United States Department of Education Student Privacy Policy Office regarding an investigation into compliance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act in relation to California Assembly Bill 1955. 2. Additional communication from the U.S. Department of Education to all Chief State Schools Officers and all Superintendents of Local Educational Agencies regarding obligations under FERPA, sent on March 28, 2025. 3. Any response from the California Department of Education, school officers and/or superintendents to the U.S. Department of Education. 4. Any communication between the California Department of Education, school officers and/or superintendents about federal communication or investigation.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association
Please see attached documents.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Fontana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

- Records and data that outlines what was purchased using money from the fund, including dates, descriptions, and total spent. 

- Any annual reports produced civil asset forfeiture program.

- Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the department Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the department

- Sales of non-monetary assets, receipts of sale for vehicles, or the destruction of other non-monetary assets

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.
 
The period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Preferably released in .CSV form when possible

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Daijah Cano Arrest – May 13, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Daijah Cano on May 13, 2023, at approximately 12:31 AM, at or near 1200 Milton, Doña Ana County, NM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD).

Specifically, I am seeking:

The arrest report, including officer narratives, probable cause statements, and any citations or charges filed

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage recorded by arresting or responding officers

The 911 call audio and transcript, if one was made in connection with this incident

Any booking photos (mugshots) and related documentation

Any dispatch records or CAD logs for this incident

This request is made in the interest of transparency and public accountability in routine law enforcement actions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Police Records Request, Reference # P000732-040625 Dear Thomas Jackson, The City of Las Cruces received the following public records request from you on April 07, 2025: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Daijah Cano on May 13, 2023, at approximately 12:31 AM, at or near 1200 Milton, Doña Ana County, NM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD). 

Specifically, I am seeking: 

The arrest report, including officer narratives, probable cause statements, and any citations or charges filed 

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage recorded by arresting or responding officers 

The 911 call audio and transcript, if one was made in connection with this incident 

Any booking photos (mugshots) and related documentation 

Any dispatch records or CAD logs for this incident 

This request is made in the interest of transparency and public accountability in routine law enforcement actions. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Thomas Jackson 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flas-cruces-new-mexico-police-department-4431%252Fdaijah-cano-arrest-may-13-2023-184476%252F%253Femail%253Dkperalta%252540las-cruces.org&url_auth_token=AAAWk2FNE129jWDSFr7SU9dcyI4%3A1u1cCG%3A5PuP2nkpn6mu6Jnm5KeSvQ_UI6bHOLlxbrqmb5RYI5Y 
The purpose of this message is to provide you with a partial response to the Inspection of Public Records Act (hereinafter “IPRA”) request you provided the City of Las Cruces (hereinafter “City” or “Las Cruces”). The City has gathered, reviewed, and appropriately redacted the following public records associated with your request: 
One (1) document and four (4) videos 
 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) Section 14-2-1.1 states “Protected personal identifier information contained in public records may be redacted by a public body before inspection or copying of a record.” The term “protected personal identifier information” is defined within NMSA Section 14-2-6(F) to include:  (1) all but the last four digits of a: (a) taxpayer identification number;  (b) financial account number; (c) credit or debit card number; or (d) driver’s license number;  (2) all but the year of a person’s date of birth; (3) a social security number; and (4) with regard to a nonelected employee of a public body in the context of the person’s employment, the employee’s nonbusiness home street address, but not the city, state or zip code;  therefore, any of the above-described “protected personal identifier information” found within the responsive records have been redacted. 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1.2(A)(8) states, in pertinent part, that “Law enforcement records are public records, except “records pertaining to physical or mental examination and medical treatment of persons unless the information could be relevant to a criminal investigation or an investigation of misfeasance, malfeasance or other suspected violation of law conducted by a person elected to or employed by a public body,” and therefore, such records “may be redacted from a written record or digitally obscured in a visual or audio record.” Therefore, any medical records and/or the discussion of medical diagnosis found within the responsive records have been redacted. New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1(J) states that every person has a right to inspect public records of this state except “information concerning information technology systems, the publication of which would reveal specific vulnerabilities that compromise or allow unlawful access to such systems; provided that this subsection shall not be used to restrict requests for (1) records stored or transmitted using information technology systems and (2) internal and external audits of information technology systems, except for those portions that would reveal ongoing vulnerabilities that compromise or allow unlawful access to such systems.” Therefore, any records that would disclose methods for unlawfully accessing technology systems contained within the responsive records have been redacted. A download link with the contents of this request has been e-mailed to you from AXON.  This download link expires in three (3) days. Please contact our office by replying to this email or via telephone if you have any issues accessing the documents or if you wish to receive the documents in another format. Pursuant to NMSA 1978, § 14-2-10, the City has determined that your written request is excessively burdensome and/or broad. More specifically, the City has determined that it requires an additional reasonable period of time to gather, review, and appropriately redact any and all public records associated with your request.  Although the City cannot anticipate when the remainder of the responsive records associated with your request will become available, the City will produce them within a reasonable period of time. Further, the City will provide a written status update regarding your request within fifteen (15) days. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Should you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact my office. Sincerely, 
Christine Rivera 
Records Custodian 
(575) 541-2112

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Danyel Oliveras Arrest – February 12, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Danyel A. Oliveras on February 12, 2025, at approximately 11:07 AM, by the Hillsborough County Sheriff’s Office. The arrest occurred at or near 1508 Diehl Dr., Hillsborough County, Florida.

According to public records, Oliveras was charged with the following offenses:

Eight counts of Possession of Child Pornography – Florida Statute CHAB0001

One count of In-State Transmission of Child Pornography via Electronic Device – Florida Statute LEWD6070A

One count of Transmission of Harmful Material to Minor – Florida Statute LEWD5080

One count of Unlawful Use of Two-Way Communications Device – Florida Statute MISC1354
Bond for each offense: $2,500

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including investigative summaries, detective narratives, and charging documents

Any available digital forensic reports, electronic evidence logs, or device search warrants

Body-worn camera (BWC) footage, if applicable, from the arrest or investigation

Photographs or digital evidence related to the case

CAD logs, dispatch records, or any communications between deputies and the subject

Documentation submitted to the State Attorney’s Office

Due to the serious nature of the charges involving electronic transmission of child exploitation materials, this request is made in the public interest to better understand the investigation and procedures surrounding these offenses.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

communications.subject: Welcome to the Hillsborough County Sheriff's Office Public Records Request Center
communications.communication:

communications.subject: Records Request :: P315338-040625
communications.communication:
Dear Thomas Jackson: This is to acknowledge your records request was received on 4/6/2025 and given reference number P315338-040625 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Danyel A. Oliveras on February 12, 2025, at approximately 11:07 AM, by the Hillsborough County Sheriff’s Office. The arrest occurred at or near 1508 Diehl Dr., Hillsborough County, Florida.

According to public records, Oliveras was charged with the following offenses:

Eight counts of Possession of Child Pornography – Florida Statute CHAB0001

One count of In-State Transmission of Child Pornography via Electronic Device – Florida Statute LEWD6070A

One count of Transmission of Harmful Material to Minor – Florida Statute LEWD5080

One count of Unlawful Use of Two-Way Communications Device – Florida Statute MISC1354
Bond for each offense: $2,500

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including investigative summaries, detective narratives, and charging documents

Any available digital forensic reports, electronic evidence logs, or device search warrants

Body-worn camera (BWC) footage, if applicable, from the arrest or investigation

Photographs or digital evidence related to the case

CAD logs, dispatch records, or any communications between deputies and the subject

Documentation submitted to the State Attorney’s Office

Due to the serious nature of the charges involving electronic transmission of child exploitation materials, this request is made in the public interest to better understand the investigation and procedures surrounding these offenses.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fhillsborough-county-sheriff-775%252Fdanyel-oliveras-arrest-february-12-2025-184488%252F%253Femail%253Ddalvarez%252540hcso.tampa.fl.us&url_auth_token=AAAfHGf7Mp_SsjDJm51r_CDMGvA%3A1u1cEO%3A6U9nXnc8Jax8d2HiUh8YX4iZLbA_b3Rav156E7o2ZO0 Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Hillsborough County Sheriff’s Office Public Records Website.
